Оказывается, старший инструктор по строевой и боевой подготовке Хартман отправляет тебя с КМБ не только во Вьетнам, но и в Чёрную Мезу, чтобы бороться с Зен-конговцами...

Para ser considerado una expansión del Half - Life original esta muy bien hecha, obviamente no tiene la duración que da el juego original pero te muestra el otro lado de la historia, incluye nuevos enemigos y expande el arsenal. Tiene un pequeño error de configuración inicial que no permite al jugador mover la cámara libremente, pero se soluciona fácilmente desde la configuración de controles marcando la opción de input por mouse.

Muy buen juego, te muestra otro punto de vista de que pasa en black mesa, expande el catalogo de armas e incluso muestra una nueva raza de alienigenas. Recomendadisimo (Pero primero juega half life normal antes de jugar las expansiones 7-7).

If you like Half-life, you will probably like Opposing Force. Mostly the same experience but with different puzzles and weapons and character.
G-Man please let Adrian out

Era il 1999 quando una giovane Gearbox, tirò fuori dal cilindro una breve ma intensa espansione di Half-Life. In Opposing Force infatti impersoneremo Adrian Shepard, membro dei marines, che si contrapporrà alle gesta di Gordon Freeman. Torneremo quindi nel caro vecchio complesso di Black Mesa, ma non senza alcune interessanti novità. Le nuove armi e tipologie di nemici introdotte infatti donano varietà al titolo, nonostante una sensazione di déjà-vu scontata, ma che di certo non rappresenta un punto a sfavore. Da segnalare inoltre anche una difficoltà maggiore rispetto all'opera principale, anche se parliamo di alcuni specifici punti dall'avventura. Per il resto si tratta di un copia/incolla del titolo principale, con tutti i pro e contro del caso, ma del resto non può essere altrimenti, essendo la storia narrata all'interno dello stesso arco temporale. Must buy, senza se e senza ma!

Brand new enemies, allies and weapons. It's very fun, but also a huge missed opportunity to go kill some scientists. You barely meet any and you instead aren't even supposed to kill them (you still can, though) as the game says that he crashed before he got the orders to kill them. Not to mention an even easier and more boring boss fight than the HL1 boss..

Hola. Buenas tardes, O.F. es una expansión un poco sosa de half life, la inteligencia artificial esta rota, mucho CTRL + SALTO, no es tan cercana a Half Life como pensé que seria. Los lados buenos son que agregan nuevos enemigos, armas y vemos un poco el lado de los soldados en el asedio a black mesa, también aparecen mas partes que me hacen un intento de terror, mas que nada llegando al final. Igualmente siento que los enemigos ser reciclaron demasiado hasta unos de los primeros jefes del juego original tiene una versión acá que es igual, solo que no tarda tanto.

Le doy 2 SAPES de 5

If you played the first half-life, and was like "hmmm, that was cool, but i want more." then opposing force is the good shit. The new additions to the game are really interesting, and work pretty well for the most part. I do have a few issues with it though. The only issues I have is one issue with the mouse, and the AI. The mouse will sometimes just not want to work, but you can fix this by enabling raw mouse input. The AI though can kinda just want to kill you for no reason. Like, I will literally blow up a tripmine trap, and the gad dam squad members will literally shoot me. I guess this issue can be fixed by telling them to stay put. Though when the AI does want to help you, which is basically every time you get to see Otis, it really shows the prowess for a game made in 1999. The AI works for the most part though, I'm just having some personal issues with it. Good game. :)

Such a fantastic game that fits neatly into the Half-Life universe!

Really good add-on to Half Life 1. It adds new guns, enemies, and an interesting side story that takes place during the events of the main game. As usual with old games like this, the platforming can get a little finicky and enemies can be pretty brutal at times, so I hope you like loading saves a lot. Very much worth the play though.

Купил эту игру года так 1 назад, и у меня не было желание пройти эту игру, вот сейчас, 2021 год, я всё таки взял, и прошёл её, и не зря. 
Сюжет мне понравился, но лично мне, он короткий.
Также и геймплей, ты можешь взять с собой подчиненных, и идти перестреливаться с врагами, что конечно-же круто!
Ещё я хотел попробовать посмотреть как там дела с сетевой игрой, но как ожидалось, сервера много, но они пусты, на некоторых от силы играют 1-2 человека.
Оценка: 8 из 10. 
P.S: брал по скидке за 14 грн)

é uma expansão muito interessante, achei a melhor do Half Life, pois joguei as outras duas "Blue Shift" e "Decay", é uma expansão que adiciona diversas coisas como armas, inimigos, Texturas, modelos e etc, ela é recheada de pequenos enigmas que não são tão difíceis porém não tão fáceis assim, a expansão também conta com mais membros da Black Ops, que no Half Life original só existia um tipo de membro, sendo a "Black ops Female Assassin", agora tendo até veículos aéreos! zerei ele em 5 horas, é curto até mas isso não faz o jogo ser ruim. 8/10

Прекрасное дополнение в отличии от Blue Shift, поскольку игра не просто паразитирует на оригинале, а добавляет множество новых механик, врагов и оружия. 
После первого вышеперечисленного дополнения это просто манна небесная, гейм и левел дизайны снова максимально интуитивны и вовлекательны. Игра постоянно удивляет и исключительно радует.
 Также практически никаких багов кроме двух вылетов не случалось снова же в отличии от Blue Shift.
Вот это дополнение, вот как надо было делать и первое, брать хороший фундамент и насаживать на него новые элементы, а не просто дать побегать за нового героя пару часиков с очень ограниченным арсеналом по тем же самым локациям.

This game is disappointing, the art style of the newer aliens introduced in this expansion feel out of place when compared to the originals.

Another issue with Opposing Force would have to be the fact you do not hunt down any of the science team and kill them. What is even the point of playing as the enemy then? 
The entire reason the HECU were enemies was because they were ordered to cover up the Resonance Cascade, but this game starts near the end of the Half-Life campaign where the soldiers begin to evacuate the facility. Why even bother making this expansion? It's just Half-Life but without the amazing set pieces that game offered.

Adrian Shepherd is the protagonist of this game, and a pretty boring one at that, he never speaks or give us anything that would develop his character. Adrian is just a Gordon Freeman clone, except not even as interesting.

Friendlies can and will shoot you if you are in line of sight, sometimes they won't move unless they feel like it.

The whole experience feels like a giant waste of time to me, you start the game off as a reinforcement for the HECU that is currently fighting the aliens, not even halfway in the game you are then told the next objective is to evacuate black mesa. Fast forward maybe two hours later, if that, the game ends and black mesa is nuked. The ending is a big letdown, when I first beat the game, my initial reaction was "Wait, that was it?" I wasn't aware that it was the final boss either, 

Valve has not directly stated that Opposing Force is cannon. So considering that, I would say that this is probably a very good experience if you look at it as a fanmade project, but this is suppose to be an expansion to Half-Life, which it fails to do me imo. The story adds nothing that we haven't seen from Half-Life already, and the levels leave more to be desired.

Better than HL1. Cooler enemies, cooler weapons, better puzzles, more fun.

Opposing Force is the better of the 2 expansions for Half-Life. More weapons, ALOT more enemies, and more difficult in my opinion. Its around the same length as Blue Shift, but more fights with more enemy types, since this is a few hours after the resonance cascade, you'll see more end game aliens and military. My only issue with this game, are the escorts you need to do more often. Lead a medic to an injured engineer then escort the engineer to a door, all the while dealing with the terrible AI as they bug out or get stuck. Its passable, about on par with Elder Scrolls companions or scripting (as in its fucking terrible and buggy as hell sometimes).

More Half-Life is a win in my book, hopefully Valve will actually do something with Sheppard in the coming games. Probably not, but you bet your ass the Half-Life fanboys will flip the fuck out if they see a green helmet in a Half-Life trailer.
